data.text: @florian_krammer @jonbarnesgeo Does this mean you are monitoring infection rates before the need for hospitalization? It seems crazy to use a metric to warn people that lags 3 weeks behind the surge. Wear masks whenever you can!

@jonbarnesgeo Well, we are monitoring BA.2. There is actually a group of scientists in the US, the SARS-CoV-2 Assessment of Viral Evolution (SAVE) group, that does that pretty intensively. Just because I am happy that case numbers are low doesn't mean we are not paying attention.

@florian_krammer Narrator: It didn't stay like that. 
*Monty python foot smash*
Narrator: and now for another wave
(Cut to generic politician press conference)
Politician: we had no idea BA.2 was going to be bad.
Group of scientists in audience: No one ever expects the next varriant
@florian_krammer Hi Florian, can you please speak to Hong Kong and why they seem to be having so much trouble at the moment?

@florian_krammer @fraugenervt In NL there was a lockdown in place before the omicron wave started. The whole omicron happened during lockdown.

I suspect that the easier a virus spreads and infects, the less effect a lockdown has.
@florian_krammer Iâ€™m so nervous though about Mayor Adams foregoing mask mandates. Gonna continue to wear mine. Thanks for everything you put out @florian_krammer ! I trust you over the CDC!
@fraugenervt @PeterFaberSP Yes, I guess if you drop countermeasures at the peak of the wave its never very helpful.
